Veronica Boyce

Knitting

I learned to knit summer of 2013. So far, I still mostly follow patterns, but I’ve done a little bit of designing my own patterns. These are most of my more recent projects, and thus skew heavily toward lacework.

Lace

Green Triangle Shawl

Made Fall 2017. Pattern is Sunflower Shawl from New Vintage Lace by Andrea Jurgrau.

Haruni Shawls

Three shawls, all from the same pattern, Haruni from Ravelry. The green one was the first lace piece I ever made (maybe 2015?). The multicolor and blue shawls were made in the next couple years. I highly recommend this pattern as an introduction to lace knitting; it has verbal descriptions of the overall idea of the pattern, and both charted and line-by-line instructions. (I used the charts and ignored the line-by-line, but the comparison was useful for making sure I understood how to read the charts.)

Owl Shawl

Large shawl knit in a heavier yarn. Pattern is Into The Woods Owl from Ravelry.

Red Shawlette

Made Spring 2017. Pattern is Willow from New Vintage Lace by Andrea Jurgrau.

Large Blue Shawl

Made Summer 2017. Pattern is Coeur d’Amour from New Vintage Lace by Andrea Jurgrau.

Green Rectangular Shawl

Pattern is Print O’the Wave Stole from Ravelry. Made Winter 2017-2018.

Not-lace

Bunny Hat

Intarsia hat, worked “flat” and then seamed. I used this pattern from Ravelry for the bunnies, the rest is my own design.

Gloves

Pattern is Slip Stitch Flip Tops from Ravelry. Made Spring 2018. Made using the magic-loop method, as I refuse to use anything but circular needles. (Actually, every project on this page was made on circular needles, and thus magic-looped if it was worked in the round and had a small circumference.)

Fair Isle Hat

Fair Isle hat. My own design, parts of the pattern adapted from Winter Forest Tam and Hydrangea Fair Isle Doll Vest. I had made the Winter Forest Tam earlier, but (at least in the yarn I used), the supposedly adult-size hat ended up toddler-sized. I was dissappointed, but gave it to an appreciative toddler. Even earlier, I had started the Doll Vest as a way to learn Fair Isle, but never finished.

Other, as-yet-unphotographed projects

  • Geometric colorwork hat (own design)
  • Bramblewood Vest I picked up and did ribbing for arm and neck edges, rather than the suggested i-cord.
  • Carnaby Skirt
  • Wrap Around Skirt
  • Dragon Slayer Dog Sweater (made following the pattern, and then later modified to have a velcro opening down the tummy, cloth lining, and cloth sleeves, so it was practical for the dog to wear it without snagging or fights getting into it)
  • another dog sweater, my first (and perhaps only?) attempt at knitting from a sewing pattern
  • Date Night Made Spring 2016, in part during 9.00 lectures. In part due to yarn choice (and also pattern sizing?), did not fit me well, even after sleeve modification. I later gave it away to a friend.
